security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with guidelines, examples, and templates for creating Claude Agent skills. No executable code, no network operations, no filesystem modifications, no command execution capabilities. Entirely safe for installation.

content.value_statement: Creating Claude Agent skills requires careful attention to naming, structure, and content organization. This skill provides comprehensive guidelines, templates, and examples to help you build skills that are easy to discover, understand, and execute effectively.
actual_capabilities: Provides step-by-step guide for creating SKILL.md files
Explains naming conventions and description requirements
Offers ready-to-use templates for basic and workflow skills
Shows good and bad skill examples with improvements
Covers trigger keywords, workflow design, and error handling
Includes quality checklists and troubleshooting guidance
limitations: Does not execute or test skills automatically
Does not create files on the filesystem
Does not access external APIs or services
Provides guidance only - user must implement skills

use_cases.title: Build Your First Skill
use_cases.description: Learn the fundamentals of creating well-structured SKILL.md files with proper naming, frontmatter, and content organization.

use_cases.title: Standardize Skill Templates
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill structures across your organization using provided templates and best practices.

use_cases.title: Improve Existing Skills
use_cases.description: Refactor vague or poorly structured skills using concrete examples and improvement patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Create Basic Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new SKILL.md for a skill that helps with [specific task]. Use the create-skill-file skill guidelines. Include clear naming, proper frontmatter, trigger keywords, and step-by-step workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Review Skill Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my current SKILL.md and suggest improvements using the create-skill-file best practices. Check naming, description clarity, trigger keywords, and workflow organization.

prompt_templates.title: Build Workflow Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a workflow-style SKILL.md for [complex process]. Include preparation phases, decision points, validation steps, error handling, and rollback procedures using the workflow template.

prompt_templates.title: Fix Common Issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Take this vague skill: [paste SKILL.md]. Transform it into a well-structured skill using the create-skill-file guidelines. Show before and after comparison.

output_examples.input: Create a skill for managing database migrations using Alembic
output: A well-structured SKILL.md with proper YAML frontmatter
Clear description with trigger keywords like 'Alembic', 'migration', 'schema'
When to Use section listing 4-5 specific scenarios
Step-by-step workflow for creating and applying migrations
Code examples with actual Alembic commands
Best practices checklist and troubleshooting section

best_practices: Use specific, descriptive skill names with action verbs (e.g., 'creating-api-docs' not 'helper')
Write descriptions in third person with trigger keywords for activation
Limit SKILL.md to 200-500 lines; use subfiles for deeper documentation
Provide concrete examples with actual code, not abstract descriptions
anti_patterns: Using vague names like 'helper', 'utility', or 'manager' without specificity
Including Claude already knows (general programming knowledge, common commands)
Writing tutorials instead of actionable guides with executable steps
Skipping validation steps or error handling guidance

faq.question: What tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill supports Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. It provides general guidelines applicable across all Claude Agent platforms.

faq.question: How long should my SKILL.md be?
faq.answer: Ideal length is 200-500 lines. Keep it concise. If longer, split content into separate reference files in templates/ or examples/ subdirectories.

faq.question: Can I include scripts in my skill?
faq.answer: Yes, place executable scripts in a scripts/ subdirectory. Reference them from SKILL.md. Scripts should have shebangs, docstrings, and proper error handling.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using skills?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation guidelines. It does not access files, networks, or execute commands. Other skills you create may have different capabilities.

faq.question: How is this different from the official Claude skills documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides practical templates, concrete examples of good and bad skills, step-by-step improvement guides, and FastGPT-specific conventions not covered in official docs.

faq.question: Should I use templates or write from scratch?
faq.answer: Start with the provided templates (basic-skill-template.md or workflow-skill-template.md). They include required sections and proper structure that you can customize for your use case.
